page.title: 01GAZETTEER
page.content: This area of E.Cornwall lies 4 miles N.os Callington. The ancient city port of Plymouth is 17 miles S.E. Liskeard and Launceston, two historic market towns,lie 1o miles S.W. and N. respectively, and serve the large farming community. The roads B3257 and A388 bisect the area from N.W. to S.E.their junction being 4 miles N.of Callington.There are many minor roads,lanes and paths.A prehistoric ley from E.Anglia to Penzance runs N.E.to S.W. The parish boundry divides the quiet, thinly populated part ofSOUTH HILL from the more populous and socially active part of STOKE CLIMSLAND. Here are no large industries,no cafes, no pubs, no tourist attractions.There is much going on, however, in sport and culturee in this friendly community.
